snippet: The recent downturn has lasted a grueling six years, and while fewer people are losing their jobs, many who became unemployed in 2008 and 2009 are still looking.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes that total number of Americans employed in the private sector has almost fully recovered to the figure in January 2008, whien the job total peaked just after the Great Recession began; holds that downturn has lasted a grueling six years, and while fewer people are losing their jobs, many who became unemployed in 2008 and 2009 are still looking.
lead_paragraph: The recent downturn has lasted a grueling six years, and while fewer people are losing their jobs, many who became unemployed in 2008 and 2009 are still looking.

headline.print_headline: Private Employment Slowly Reclaims Pre-Downturn Peak
headline.main: Private Employment Slowly Reclaims Pre-Downturn Peak
